channel.title: Comments on: CentMail: Do Good, Fight Spam

item.title: By: Daniel Carrera
item.dc:creator: Daniel Carrera
item.description:
Any idea when you'll launch? I think CentMail is a brilliant idea. In addition to all the spam-fighting reasons, I think CentMail has the potential to get people thinking about charity. In particular, research shows that people are more willing to donate to charity if they realize that other people are donating too. So CentMail might actually do a lot of good for the poorest people in the world. That's a nice win-win: Reduce spam, increase charitable giving. I love it!
When will you launch?
item.content:encoded:
Any idea when you’ll launch? I think CentMail is a brilliant idea. In addition to all the spam-fighting reasons, I think CentMail has the potential to get people thinking about charity. In particular, research shows that people are more willing to donate to charity if they realize that other people are donating too. So CentMail might actually do a lot of good for the poorest people in the world. That’s a nice win-win: Reduce spam, increase charitable giving. I love it!

When will you launch?

item.title: By: dreeves
item.dc:creator: dreeves
item.description:
Thanks Vishal, we do cite the paper by Thede Loder et al in our technical paper. And I'm a fan of <a href="http://boxbe.com"/ rel="nofollow">boxbe</a>, too.
Thanks everyone else for all the interest in <a href="http://centmail.net"/ rel="nofollow">CentMail</a>! We're not sure about any specific charities but hope to have some with international appeal when we launch. Nothing else about CentMail precludes international users.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Vishal, we do cite the paper by Thede Loder et al in our technical paper. And I’m a fan of boxbe, too.

Thanks everyone else for all the interest in CentMail! We’re not sure about any specific charities but hope to have some with international appeal when we launch. Nothing else about CentMail precludes international users.

item.title: By: Daniel Carrera
item.dc:creator: Daniel Carrera
item.description: I read the technical paper and the FAQ. CentMail sounds really promising. I'm very excited about it. Will it be available in other countries? Will I be able to select non-US charities? (e.g. Oxfam in the UK).
item.content:encoded: I read the technical paper and the FAQ. CentMail sounds really promising. I’m very excited about it. Will it be available in other countries? Will I be able to select non-US charities? (e.g. Oxfam in the UK).

item.title: By: Vishal
item.dc:creator: Vishal
item.description: check out boxbe [<a href="http://www.boxbe.com"/ rel="nofollow">http://www.boxbe.com</a>]. Thede should be able to supply underlying academic work...
item.content:encoded: check out boxbe [http://www.boxbe.com/]. Thede should be able to supply underlying academic work…

item.title: By: pch65
item.dc:creator: pch65
item.description: I wonder will it available for all countries ? I'm living in France.
item.content:encoded:
I wonder will it available for all countries ?
I’m living in France.

item.title: By: Alistair Jardine
item.dc:creator: Alistair Jardine
item.description: I wonder Will it available for Great Britain? (Pennymail) and benefit British Charity's.?
item.content:encoded:
I wonder Will it available for Great Britain? (Pennymail)
and benefit British Charity’s.?

item.title: By: Gordon Rios
item.dc:creator: Gordon Rios
item.description: Haha, brilliant! Like the inverse of a "safelist" ... let the real email senders pay to charity in order to self-identify. Email clients already do network lookups for Real Time Bl(o)cklists to filter out some of the spam traffic but the Safelist has always been problematic since it required the receiver to be precognitive in order to pass through new senders.
item.content:encoded: Haha, brilliant! Like the inverse of a “safelist” … let the real email senders pay to charity in order to self-identify. Email clients already do network lookups for Real Time Bl(o)cklists to filter out some of the spam traffic but the Safelist has always been problematic since it required the receiver to be precognitive in order to pass through new senders.

item.title: By: dreeves
item.dc:creator: dreeves
item.description: Thanks for asking! We'll be in touch...
item.content:encoded: Thanks for asking! We’ll be in touch…

item.title: By: Jeff Doyle
item.dc:creator: Jeff Doyle
item.description: Your frequently asked questions says that you will provide a list of eligible charities. I assume that any legitimate 501c3 organization is eligible but how do we get on the list?
item.content:encoded: Your frequently asked questions says that you will provide a list of eligible charities. I assume that any legitimate 501c3 organization is eligible but how do we get on the list?
